tweet_text: In 1947, Brazil's top diplomat Oswaldo Aranha presided over the Assembly's First Special Session and was elected president of the second session of the General Assembly. Since the 10th Session in 1955, Brazil has always spoken first, followed by the USA, with few exceptions .
